input_text:
Job Title: Manufacturing Engineer

Location: Manila, AR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Southworth Products, Inc., located in Manila, Arkansas, has an immediate opening for a Manufacturing Engineer.

Southworth is the world’s largest manufacturer of ergonomic material handling equipment for vertical lifting and work positioning. Our products are designed to improve worker productivity while reducing the potential for worker injuries. Anywhere that workers are lifting and positioning items, handling pallets, working with parts in containers or transporting loads in a factory or warehouse, Southworth has a product to make the job faster, safer, and easier.

We realize that our success is a direct result of the efforts of our talented and dedicated employees. To ensure continued success we take extra care to make sure that careers at Southworth are financially, intellectually, emotionally, and socially rewarding for all. We offer a generous time off policy, 401k match, affordable health and vision coverage, tuition reimbursement, development plans for career growth, work from home flexibility, and a fun engaged workforce!

We are seeking an experienced Manufacturing Engineer with the following skills and abilities:

Primary Functions

Support Service Field Department by supervising installation of products at the customers facility.

Provide Customer Service Support including site visits to evaluate and resolve problems.

Check orders as released from Design Engineering for errors, functionability, and manufacturability.

Resolve manufacturing issues on the plant floor.

Conduct time & motion studies to improve manufacturing efficiency.

Determine tool and fixture needs for current and future production requirements.

Continuous Improvement

Capital Projects

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related technical field. (Electrical Engineering preferred)

2+ years of prior relevant experience.

Working knowledge of CAD (Solidworks preferred)

Programmable Logic Controller Programming Experience Is Preferred.

Ability to efficiently troubleshoot electrical and hydraulic systems from schematics.

Thorough knowledge of hydraulic power systems and controls.

Working knowledge of welding and steel fabrication techniques.

Robotic welding knowledge and experience is a bonus.

Strong analytical skills.

Excellent project management skills.

Must be able to perform and manage multiple tasks at once, able to work without direct supervision and willing to work flexible hours.

Proficient in Microsoft Office.

Travel required.

Must be able to bend, twist, reach and grasp with fingers.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
